title: SF-36
author: John Doe
description: a survey to measure quality of life

1.question: In general, would you say your health is:

2.question: Compared to one year ago, how would you rate your health in general now?

responses.5: Much better now than one year ago
responses.4: Somewhat better now than one year ago
responses.2: Somewhat worse now than one year ago
responses.1: Much worse now than one year ago

3.instructions: The following items are about activities you might do during a typical day. Does your health limit you in these activities? If so, how much?
3.question: Vigorous activities, such as running, lifting heavy objects, participating in strenuous sports

4.instructions: The following items are about activities you might do during a typical day. Does your health limit you in these activities? If so, how much?
4.question: Moderate activities, such as moving a table. pushing a vacuum cleaner, bowling, or playing golf

5.instructions: The following items are about activities you might do during a typical day. Does your health limit you in these activities? If so, how much?
5.question: Lifting or carrying groceries

6.instructions: The following items are about activities you might do during a typical day. Does your health limit you in these activities? If so, how much?
6.question: Climbing several flights of stairs

7.instructions: The following items are about activities you might do during a typical day. Does your health limit you in these activities? If so, how much?
7.question: Climbing one flight of stairs

8.instructions: The following items are about activities you might do during a typical day. Does your health limit you in these activities? If so, how much?
8.question: Bending, kneeling, or stooping

9.instructions: The following items are about activities you might do during a typical day. Does your health limit you in these activities? If so, how much?
9.question: Walking more than a mile

10.instructions: The following items are about activities you might do during a typical day. Does your health limit you in these activities? If so, how much?
10.question: Walking several blocks

11.instructions: The following items are about activities you might do during a typical day. Does your health limit you in these activities? If so, how much?
11.question: Walking one block

12.instructions: The following items are about activities you might do during a typical day. Does your health limit you in these activities? If so, how much?
12.question: Bathing or dressing yourself

13.instructions: During the past 4 weeks, have you had any of the following problems with your work or other regular daily activities as a result of your physical health?
13.question: Cut down the amount of time you spent on work or other activities

14.instructions: During the past 4 weeks, have you had any of the following problems with your work or other regular daily activities as a result of your physical health?
14.question: Accomplished less than you would like

15.instructions: During the past 4 weeks, have you had any of the following problems with your work or other regular daily activities as a result of your physical health?
15.question: Were limited in the kind of work or other activities

16.instructions: During the past 4 weeks, have you had any of the following problems with your work or other regular daily activities as a result of your physical health?
16.question: Had difficulty performing the work or other activities (for example, it took extra effort)

17.instructions: During the past 4 weeks, have you had any of the following problems with your work or other regular daily activities as a result of any emotional problems (such as feeling depressed or anxious)?
17.question: Cut down the amount of time you spent on work or other activities

18.instructions: During the past 4 weeks, have you had any of the following problems with your work or other regular daily activities as a result of any emotional problems (such as feeling depressed or anxious)?
18.question: Accomplished less than you would like

19.instructions: During the past 4 weeks, have you had any of the following problems with your work or other regular daily activities as a result of any emotional problems (such as feeling depressed or anxious)?
19.question: Didn't do work or other activities as carefully as usual

20.question: During the past 4 weeks, to what extent has your physical health or emotional problems interfered with your normal social activities with family, friends, neighbors, or groups?

21.question: How much bodily pain have you had during the past 4 weeks?

22.question: During the past 4 weeks, how much did pain interfere with your normal work (including both work outside the home and housework)?

23.instructions: These questions are about how you feel and how things have been with you during the past 4 weeks. For each question, please give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling.
23.question: Did you feel full of pep?

responses.4: A good bit of the time

24.instructions: These questions are about how you feel and how things have been with you during the past 4 weeks. For each question, please give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling.
24.question: Have you been a very nervous person?

responses.3: A good bit of the time

25.instructions: These questions are about how you feel and how things have been with you during the past 4 weeks. For each question, please give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling.
25.question: Have you felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer you up?

responses.3: A good bit of the time

26.instructions: These questions are about how you feel and how things have been with you during the past 4 weeks. For each question, please give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling.
26.question: Have you felt calm and peaceful?

responses.4: A good bit of the time

27.instructions: These questions are about how you feel and how things have been with you during the past 4 weeks. For each question, please give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling.
27.question: Did you have a lot of energy?

responses.4: A good bit of the time

28.instructions: These questions are about how you feel and how things have been with you during the past 4 weeks. For each question, please give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling.
28.question: Have you felt downhearted and blue?

responses.3: A good bit of the time

29.instructions: These questions are about how you feel and how things have been with you during the past 4 weeks. For each question, please give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling.
29.question: Did you feel worn out?

responses.3: A good bit of the time

30.instructions: These questions are about how you feel and how things have been with you during the past 4 weeks. For each question, please give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling.
30.question: Have you been a happy person?

responses.4: A good bit of the time

31.instructions: These questions are about how you feel and how things have been with you during the past 4 weeks. For each question, please give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling.
31.question: Did you feel tired?

responses.3: A good bit of the time

32.question: During the past 4 weeks, how much of the time has your physical health or emotional problems interfered with your social activities (like visiting with friends, relatives, etc.)?

33.instructions: How TRUE or FALSE is each of the following statements for you.
33.question: I seem to get sick a little easier than other people

34.instructions: How TRUE or FALSE is each of the following statements for you.
34.question: I am as healthy as anybody I know

35.instructions: How TRUE or FALSE is each of the following statements for you.
35.question: I expect my health to get worse

36.instructions: How TRUE or FALSE is each of the following statements for you.
36.question: My health is excellent
